item.title: Home for the holidays? Share this top cybersecurity advice with friends and family

item.title: Onyx Motorbikes is back, one year after its owner died leaving the company in shambles
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
A year after Onyx Motorbikes owner James Khatiblou died suddenly, leaving customers with unfulfilled orders and millions in unpaid debts, the brand has been revived by its original founder. “I’m excited to announce I have resurrected my original brand Onyx with incredible backers!” founder Tim Seward wrote in a LinkedIn post on Monday. “Onyx is […]

item.title: Sony’s CES 2025 press conference: How to watch
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Sony knows how to put on a show at CES. The company’s pressers are high-octane, star-studded affairs, as these things go. In addition to standard Sony fare like TVs and audio systems, there’s always a curve ball or two, be it a car, a drone, or a “Gran Turismo” movie. That’s one of the perks […]

item.title: OpenAI ‘considered’ building a humanoid robot: Report
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
OpenAI has recently explored building its own humanoid robot, according to The Information. The report cites “two people with direct knowledge” of those conversations. The ChatGPT maker has been involved in the space for some time now, by way of financial backing. It has thus far invested in Figure and 1X, along with the “general […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The promise and perils of synthetic data
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Is it possible for an AI to be trained just on data generated by another AI? It might sound like a harebrained idea. But it’s one that’s been around for quite some time — and as new, real data is increasingly hard to come by, it’s been gaining traction. Anthropic used some synthetic data to […]

item.title: Samsung’s CES 2025 press conference: How to watch
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Samsung’s CES presser is always an odd duck. The Korean electronics giant generally keeps its powder dry when it comes to consumer electronics. After all, it’s expected to announce its latest flagship handset — the Galaxy S25 — toward the end of January. CES 2025 is going to continue the company’s tradition of TVs and […]

item.title: Google is using Anthropic’s Claude to improve its Gemini AI
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description:
Contractors working on Google Gemini are comparing its responses to Claude's, according to internal correspondence seen by TechCrunch.

item.title: Revenue-based financing startups continue to raise capital in MENA, where the model just works
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
In an era where it has become tougher to raise venture capital, many companies have turned to non-dilutive, revenue-based financing (RBF) as an alternative. As a result, plenty of startups have risen to meet that challenge, none more so than in the MENA region, which has taken to the model like a duck to water. […]

item.title: Watch Boston Dynamics’ electric Atlas do a backflip
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
A little early holiday surprise from Boston Dynamics this week, as Santa suit-wearing electric Atlas performs a backflip. The feat occurs about 13 minutes into a new video, showcasing yet another trick in the humanoid robot’s arsenal. It’s worth noting that — unlike with humans — a robot performing a backflip isn’t necessarily more complicated […]

item.title: Clop ransomware gang takes credit for latest mass hack that breached dozens of companies
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker

The prolific ransomware gang says it hacked at least 66 companies by exploiting a bug in tools made by Cleo Software.

item.title: Proton’s device aims to help those with kidney disease and cut heart-failure risks
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
People with chronic kidney disease or those at risk of heart failure are greatly affected by potassium imbalances in the body. These can even be life-threatening. While wearable glucose monitors are now commonplace and have transformed the lives of diabetes patients, potassium monitoring is in its infancy, as it’s hard to do. Now startups are […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Halide’s next version will come with new film filters, HDR
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Lux, which makes the iPhone camera app Halide, published a roadmap on Monday detailing the app’s next version, called Halide Mark III, to be released sometime next year. The company said Halide Mark III will ship with two new features: Color Grades and its own take on HDR (high dynamic range) photos. The company plans […]

item.title: Hyundai is giving away free Tesla NACS adapters to its EV customers
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Hyundai said on Monday that it would send customers who have bought or leased an EV before January 31 a free charging adapter that would let them access Tesla’s supercharging network. The adapter will enable CCS-port-equipped Hyundai EVs to access more than 20,000 Tesla Superchargers in the United States, Hyundai said. The free adapters will […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: OpenAI’s o3 suggests AI models are scaling in new ways — but so are the costs
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Last month, AI founders and investors told TechCrunch that we’re now in the “second era of scaling laws,” noting how established methods of improving AI models were showing diminishing returns. One promising new method they suggested could keep gains was “test-time scaling,” which seems to be what’s behind the performance of OpenAI’s o3 model — […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Elon Musk’s xAI lands $6B in new cash to fuel AI ambitions
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
xAI, Elon Musk’s AI company, has raised $6 billion, according to a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday. Investors gave a minimum of $77,593, per the filing (97 participated, but the document doesn’t reveal their identities). xAI later announced (confirming some earlier reporting) that Andreessen Horowitz , Blackrock, Fidelity, Kingdom Holdings, […]

item.title: Venture capitalists continue to play musical chairs
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
From Keith Rabois to Matt Miller, a lot of VCs have switched firms or spun out of storied VC institutions this year. These employment changes are surprising because unlike in many other fields, venture capitalists don’t traditionally move around very much — especially those who reach the partner or general partner level. VC funds have […]
